title: Practice-Based Simulation Training for Interagency Collaboration in Domestic Violence Intervention

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of domestic violence prevention and response, understanding of related institutional processes
context.additional_context: Course Strengthening Practical Learning Competencies for Current Practitioners Through Experiencing Victim-Centered Interagency Collaboration Cases

learning_goals: Learners can construct inter-agency collaboration systems involving three or more institutions in a simulation environment, centered on victim case studies
Learners apply effective communication strategies in inter-agency conflict scenarios through VR-based role-playing
Learners produce actionable inter-agency collaboration manuals applicable to real-world cases through project-based assessment
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
